unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify strategies for addressing ethical issues that may arise in the workplace.
Demonstrate ability to behave professionally in a workplace context.
Apply reflection skills to learn from practice.
Adapt content and mode of communication in the workplace based on the audience for the information.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Engagement with online modules between face-to-face seminars
Review of online materials in advance of seminars

enrolment_rules.description: (Admission to BProfPrac or BActStudProfPrac(Hons)) or permission by special approval

assessments.description: Students review three online modules and reflect on how the module content applies in practice and/or in their studies.
Students identify three areas (skills, attributes, etc.) they have developed while on placement and include both an artifact and description of their development in each area in an ePortfolio.
Workplace supervisors evaluate student performance on placement using a rubric. Students reflect on their supervisor feedback and their own performance evaluation.

Students consult with their placement supervisors (guided by a template) to develop learning objectives and activities for their placement. Learning objectives should be relevant to the tasks, responsibilities and expected outcomes of the placement.

data.description: This unit offers an academic foundation for a professional experience in a workplace. Students will further develop their professional communication skills, understanding of professional ethics and application of reflective practice. Students will explore and develop project management skills based on their experience in the workplace, including the use of technology to support project planning and management. While students admitted to a Co-op course have enrolment priority for this unit, a limited number of spaces are open to students enrolled in other degrees.
data.title: Professional Practice Placement 1
